intro: Cyrtandra hendrianii, commonly known as the Hawaiian bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and stream banks. It has opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, it is considered endangered and is protected under conservation efforts.
